title: American_Top_40_1970_August_1st
description:
"Every week from Hollywood we countdown the forty top tunes from Boston Harbor to Pearl Harbor. This is Casey Kasem and the countdown continues."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

Casey informs that the song "Maybe" by The Three Degrees (at number 35) is a remake of a hit by The Chantels from 1957, and "Summertime Blues" by The Who (at number 33) was first done by Eddie Cochran in 1958, and then by Blue Cheer in 1968.

With only 112 hit songs to his name, the soon-to-be-popular Elvis is at number 24 with "The Wonder Of You."

Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young has back-to-back hits with "Ohio" and "Teach Your Children" (at numbers 17 and 16).

There is a band named War with their hit "Spill The Wine" (at number 7) and a song called "War" (by Edwin Star at number 12).

And from the department of RocketMan FYI: This was one of the first AT40 shows ever broadcast. The program was distributed in mono until September 1972 when the show started recording in stereo. However, as you listen, you may notice the songs in this broadcast (and other rebroadcasts from the mono period) are in stereo. If anyone is bothered by the alteration of this precious piece of history, just unplug one speaker and you will never know the difference!
